speaker: Merchant
text: Oh, that poor girl...

speaker: Chrom
text: What's wrong?

speaker: Merchant
text: Oh! Sirs, please! Help her! A young merchant girl is being set upon by bandits!

speaker: Chrom
text: We're on our way.

speaker: Vincent
text: You! We have business, you and I, and I aim to settle the debt. Victor will be avenged today!

speaker: Anna
text: Oh, dear. Have we met?

speaker: Vincent
text: Playing dumb won't save you, girly. The gold you net from the slavers will build Victor the finest grave in the land!

speaker: Anna
text: Careful, love. Prices aren't the only thing I can cut in half.

speaker: Anna
text: Hello there, handsome! Am I being rescued?

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, that was the plan, but you seem to be holding up just fine. Can you still fight?

speaker: Anna
text: I could stand to open a few more rogues, sure. Or locks, for that matter.

speaker: Chrom
text: A thief, is it?

speaker: Anna
text: Locksmith, thank you very much! But yes. Door or chest, I'll have it smiling wide in a trice. And it looks like there bandits have quite the hoard built up.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Huh. Well then, I think we're in business.

speaker: Anna
text: Ugh. Well, that was careless... Sorry, friends. Looks like I've got to close up shop for the day.

speaker: Vincent
text: You stand no chance. I'm a conqueror by name and a conqueror by nature!

speaker: Vincent
text: I... I see your face, Victor... No... No, wait... That's me...

speaker: Anna
text: Thanks for your help. The name's Anna. Some folks like to call me the Secret Seller.

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, I remember you.

speaker: Anna
text: Oh? ...Mmm, I'm afraid I'm drawing a blank.

speaker: Chrom
text: Huh? Oh, then I must be... I'm sorry. I thought you... Wait, what am I saying? I KNOW we helped you. I'm sure of it!

speaker: Anna
text: Oh! Hee hee! You must have met one of my sisters.

speaker: Chrom
text: Sisters? Gods, you look identical.

speaker: Anna
text: Yes, there's a strong family resemblance. Oh, and we're all traveling merchants.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...With the same name?

speaker: Anna
text: Yes, actually. That's part of the secret!

speaker: Chrom
text: Your family gatherings must be chaotic.

speaker: Anna
text: True, but aren't everyone's? Still, I can't just send you on your way after helping TWO of us. So let me come along and aid you in return. I can be quite useful. You'll never make a loss with me in tow—I guarantee it!

speaker: Robin
text: Is this the place?

speaker: Chrom
text: Yeah, it's got to be. The townsfolk spoke of ruins in these parts that carry the legacy of the divine dragon. Of course, they neglected to mention that the place is crawling with Risen... I suppose we're just gonna have to earn this treasure the old-fashioned way.

speaker: Morgan
text: Footsteps! ...Probably not friendly. And likely more down those stairs... Think, Morgan, think! How would Mom/Dad handle this?

speaker: Robin
text: You...don't look like a treasure hunter. What brings you here?

speaker: Morgan
text: There you are, Mother! I was beginning to think we got separated.

speaker: Robin
text: ...I'm sorry, what?

speaker: Morgan
text: Well, no harm done. At least we can head home now. ...Goodness, the air here agrees with you! You look a decade younger, at least.

speaker: Robin
text: Wait. Let's go back to the Mother thing. ...Did you travel back from the future with Lucina?

speaker: Morgan
text: Huh? Who's Lucina? And did you seriously just ask me if I came from the future? ...Why are you looking at me like that? Hello? It's me! Morgan! ...Your son? Love of your life and strapping young lad and all that? Wow, you're really acting strange today. Let's go home and get you to bed. Hmm, but which way is home? Is it— Ngh! M-my head!

speaker: Robin
text: Easy—don't try to force it! Just stay calm and listen to me. I know this sounds mad, but I believe that you came here from the future.

speaker: Morgan
text: Are you out of your mind? That's not even possible!

speaker: Robin
text: Actually, it is. Think about it. You said I looked younger, but look again. Closely. Do I look like I'm of an age where I could have a child as old as you? At this point in time, in OUR time, you still haven't been born.

speaker: Morgan
text: Y-you do look younger, but...

speaker: Robin
text: It's hard, I know. And you don't have to believe me right this minute. But you must come with me. It's dangerous alone, especially if your memory is gone. I was in the same position once, you know. If Chrom hadn't found me lying in that field, who knows what would've happened to me...

speaker: Morgan
text: Wait, you woke up in the middle of a field, too? Hah! Like mother, like son, huh? Oh, that's too funny!

speaker: Robin
text: ...Glad to see you inherited my blithe outlook. Just try to stay close, will you?

speaker: Morgan
text: Yes, ma'am!

speaker: Morgan
text: Mmm? Who are you?

speaker: Chrom
text: I would ask you the same. More importantly, why are you here? This is hardly a safe place to be wandering alone.

speaker: Morgan
text: I... I don't know, frankly. I woke up...sprawled in a field. I can't recall anything before that.

speaker: Chrom
text: That sounds familiar.

speaker: Morgan
text: I... I think I remember my name? ...Morgan? Yes, that's it. My name is Morgan.

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm Chrom. And finding amnesiacs is apparently my special talent. I met a good friend, Robin, under the same circumstances.

speaker: Morgan
text: Robin?! Is this friend of yours perchance a tactician?

speaker: Chrom
text: She is. Do you know her?

speaker: Morgan
text: Yes, I know her! She's my mother! ...Wait a second. You found my mother lying here unconscious?

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, not HERE. But yes, we found her lying in a field, memory-free. This was quite a while ago, mind you. So if you're her son, I take it you came from the future?

speaker: Morgan
text: ...From the future? Are you kidding, sir?! People can't travel through time! If that were possible, I— Ngh! M-my head!

speaker: Chrom
text: Woah, easy there. Try to stay calm. Listen, why don't you just come with us for now? You can speak to Robin later and maybe clear this up.

speaker: Morgan
text: Th-thank you, sir... And don't worry—I can defend myself. You just lead the way.

speaker: Morgan
text: ...What?! But I... The future?! Is... Is that why I have no memory? But wait, I remember my mother. So why don't I remember you?

speaker: Chrom
text: I don't know. Do you recall a sister named Lucina?

speaker: Morgan
text: No, nothing like that.

speaker: Chrom
text: I suppose it's a blessing you at least remember your mother. Maybe something will come back once you've met with her and Lucina. Until then, you'd best come with me. ...And stay close. I don't want you hurt.

speaker: Morgan
text: All right, thank you. And don't worry—I can defend myself. You just lead the way.

speaker: Chrom
text: This must be Naga's Tear... I can feel the power coursing through it.

speaker: Lissa
text: Sweet! This baby should keep us safe in the battles to come!

speaker: Chrom
text: I hope you're right about that, Sis.

speaker: Morgan
text: That's... a lot to take in.

speaker: Robin
text: It's everything we know about the situation at this point.

speaker: Morgan
text: The future I came from is in ruins... You're sure about that?

speaker: Robin
text: One possible future is in ruins, yes. But you may hail from another path. We're fighting now to ensure that no one's future is lost. Unfortunately, if you join us, it'll mean more fighting for you, too.

speaker: Morgan
text: I understand... I'm sorry, but even after hearing all that, I still don't remember anything but you.

speaker: Robin
text: Don't apologize. We'll pull your memory back bit by bit if we have to. Besides, if you start apologizing, I'll have to as well. My past is still full of holes, but I'm getting along. And you will too.

speaker: Morgan
text: As long as you're with me, the rest will work itself out. Now, come on! We've got a future that needs saving!

speaker: Robin
text: Hah! You really do take after me.

speaker: Morgan
text: You know, now that you mention it... There is one other thing I remember.

speaker: Robin
text: What's that?

speaker: Morgan
text: I've always strived to be a great tactician like you. And even though this war is terrible, at least now I can learn from you firsthand.

speaker: Robin
text: Well, you're nothing if not optimistic... Wherever or whenever you came from, I'm glad you made it here, Morgan.

speaker: Morgan
text: Me too!

speaker: Gyral
text: Turn around and get lost, swine! This land belongs to the Stonewall Knights! If you need a second notice, I'll write it down on your men's corpses!

speaker: Dalen
text: Ya-har! A pile of corpses could still outfight you sorry lot! This is our territory, and no one gives orders to the Riders of Dawn!

speaker: Chrom
text: What do you make of that?

speaker: Frederick
text: Mercenaries, from the look. Rival bands squabbling over some petty matter. A common enough sight in these dark times, milord. But if it comes to bloodletting, the nearby villages will pay for it.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then let's make sure it doesn't.

speaker: Gyral
text: Stick 'em full'a holes, boys!

speaker: Dalen
text: Time to fertilize the fields, soldiers!

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, diplomacy is probably out.

speaker: Frederick
text: Seems our best option is to end the fighting as quickly as possible. Allying ourselves with one side or the other would certainly expedite things.

speaker: Chrom
text: A band of riders or a band of knights... Time to make our choice.

speaker: Gyral
text: More sellswords? Ha! Your timing is right impeccable. I'll buy your steel and see you're well compensated for the trouble!

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, Robin? Shall we back the knights?

speaker: Dalen
text: Ya-har! There's a sensible lad. Come fight with us, instead! I'll pay you twice what that fool would!

speaker: Chrom
text: Robin?

speaker: Chrom
text: ...So it's neither, is it? Which means you aim to fight them both?

speaker: Chrom
text: I should have known... Are you sure about this? There may be more of them in hiding, you know. ...But I'll leave the final choice to you.

speaker: Chrom
text: So be it. Shepherds! To arms

speaker: Panne
text: That scent... It smells like... Ho! You there!

speaker: Yarne
text: Gyah! Wh-what do you want?!

speaker: Panne
text: You are a taguel.

speaker: Yarne
text: Yeah, well so are— GODS! M-Mother?!

speaker: Panne
text: Mother?

speaker: Yarne
text: Gah, you nearly gave me heart failure! I'd given up on EVER finding you! You wouldn't believe how dangerous it is here. All these swords and brigands... Anyway, I've found you. That makes the trip back in time more than worth it.

speaker: Panne
text: So you came with that man-spawn Lucina, did you? Hmm... Explain to me why my son consorts with common thugs?

speaker: Yarne
text: Huh? H-hey, I didn't have a choice in the matter! You were nowhere to be found, and roaming around alone is a recipe for... extinction. I'd figure I'd be safe if I took up with some strong allies, and so I... Wait, are you angry? Because you look kind of ang—

speaker: Panne
text: OF COURSE I AM ANGRY! No son of mine will survive by taking the path of the coward! You're coming with me, I'm going to teach you some taguel pride, starting right now!

speaker: Chrom
text: You there! Hold!

speaker: Yarne
text: Gyah! D-don't surprise me like that! I could die of heart failure!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...I was standing right in front of you. Ought I have waved first, or would that have been too threatening?

speaker: Yarne
text: Oh, aren't we the jester! People die from much lesser things you know. It's no laughing matter! What if you scare me and I trip and fall and cut my head open? What then?!

speaker: Chrom
text: Er...right. Look, if you're so worried about death, maybe you should just surrender. I have no desire to spill unnecessary blood.

speaker: Yarne
text: Wait, surrender is an option?! Wh-why didn't you say so?!

speaker: Yarne
text: So this is...extinction...

speaker: Elder
text: Greetings, traveler. We're backers of the Stonewall Knights. Try this lance out. It'll put those dastard riders in their place!

speaker: Villager
text: Every time this lot has a go, our fields get trampled and our houses destroyed! Ain't no matter to us which side wins so long as it's over quickly. Here, then. Take this, and get those sorry lunkheads outta here!

speaker: Maiden
text: Our village suffered enough with one band of sellswords strutting about, but two?! Here! I'll give ya this if you just make 'em stop fighting!

speaker: Elder
text: Welcome, friend. We're supporters of the Riders of Dawn here. Take this hammer. It'll send those pesky knights running for the hills!

speaker: Gyral
text: You'll never breach the impenetrable forces of the Stonewall Knights!

speaker: Dalen
text: You'll never stop the unending march of the Riders of Dawn!

speaker: Dalen
text: I'll send your fat men and their fat-man armor sailing through the sky!

speaker: Gyral
text: Horse and rider both will be red smears across our shields!

speaker: Frederick
text: The fighting is over, milord. That should spare the villages from any further damage.

speaker: Chrom
text: Good. Thought I still don't understand why they had to fight in the first place.

speaker: Frederick
text: Competition, milord. A sad consequence of this war. Farm the land, and your fields are pillaged. Open a shop, and your goods are stolen. It's little wonder men take up steel and become mercenaries. ...Or worse. There's only so much gold to go around, and so they fight for dominance.

speaker: Chrom
text: Seems they'll continue to do so until it's safe to be a farmer or merchant again. All the more reason for us to end things as quickly as possible.

speaker: Frederick
text: Well put, milord. Shall we be on our way?

speaker: Frederick
text: By the by, our erstwhile allies send their regards and a reward to match. War's an expensive proposition, but I wager blood money spends the same as any other. I'll see it's added to our tally.

speaker: Chrom
text: Thank you, Frederick.

speaker: Panne
text: You.

speaker: Yarne
text: Gyah! Y-you scared me! Don't go sneaking up behind people! You'll give them whiplash...

speaker: Panne
text: What is your name?

speaker: Yarne
text: Yarne. Don't you remember? You're the one who gave it to me.

speaker: Panne
text: ...So you truly are my child?

speaker: Yarne
text: Um, I'm a taguel, right? I kind of have to be.

speaker: Panne
text: I suppose blood does not lie. I am pleased to see you, my son. You represent a new hope for our race.

speaker: Yarne
text: No pressure there...

speaker: Panne
text: You are living proof that man and taguel can coexist.

speaker: Yarne
text: Hey, I didn't do anything special. I was just born. You're the one who proved all that bridging-the-gap stuff. You're the one who married a human. Er, thanks for doing that, by the way. Even if I can't take credit for it, I'm proud of my heritage.

speaker: Panne
text: It gladdens me to see my son value pride... May you keep it always.

speaker: Merchant
text: Blast... It seems all hope is lost. Still, hold fast. I'll treat your wounds...

speaker: Soldier
text: Ngh... It's t-too late...

speaker: Chrom
text: What's happened here?!

speaker: Merchant
text: Nothing but death ahead, travelers. I'd turn back if I were you... Whatever your business here, it will have to wait.

speaker: Chrom
text: Just tell us what happened.

speaker: Merchant
text: Bandits have blocked the road ahead. They're demanding a king's ransom in illicit tolls for all who wish to pass.

speaker: Chrom
text: They think to profiteer on refugees? Despicable.

speaker: Merchant
text: Our caravan's livelihood is at stake. We'll do no business in this country now...

speaker: Frederick
text: The flow of goods must be secured, milord, or the people are likely to starve.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then we'll secure it. You and your caravan can wait here. We'll let you know when it's safe.

speaker: Victor
text: Vincent, darling?

speaker: Vincent
text: Yes, Victor?

speaker: Victor
text: I daresay we've come across a village, Vincent.

speaker: Vincent
text: And what a thriving little hamlet it is, Victor!

speaker: Victor
text: Indeed. I think it'll make for a fine bit of pillaging, Vincent.

speaker: Vincent
text: It most certainly will, Victor.

speaker: Victor
text: Well then, I believe it's my turn to do the honors, isn't it, Vincent?

speaker: Vincent
text: I do believe it is, Victor! Oh, but try not to kill them all this time, hmm? It tends to cut into profits.

speaker: Anna
text: Hate to be the bearer of bad news, but I'm afraid this village is closed.

speaker: Victor
text: You! We have business, you and I, and I aim to settle the debt. Vincent will be avenged today!

speaker: Anna
text: Oh, dear. Have we met?

speaker: Victor
text: Playing dumb won't save you, girly. The gold you net from the slavers will build Vincent the finest grave in the land!

speaker: Anna
text: Careful, love. Us traders are known to make some very deep cuts.

speaker: Frederick
text: That village is in danger. One must ride ahead and warn them of what's coming.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Anna? What are you doing here?

speaker: Anna
text: My thanks, stranger. It's nice to see a friendly face for once.

speaker: Chrom
text: Stranger? Now I'm confused. Aren't you...? I mean... Anyway, never mind. The important thing is that you're safe. You seem to have things well in hand, but I hope you won't mind a little company? Just until we sort these rogues out.

speaker: Anna
text: Aw, you're worried! That's adorable! I welcome the assistance.

speaker: Anna
text: Ugh. Well, that was careless... Sorry, friends. Looks like I've got to close up shop for today.

speaker: Elder
text: That peddler woman was fighting to protect the village, you say? That kind of warmth is more than welcome in these cold lands. Here. Please use this to heal her if she's hurt.

speaker: Victor
text: Give up now! I was born a Victor, and victory will be mine!

speaker: Victor
text: I... I see an open field, Vincent... Such beautiful flowers...

speaker: Anna
text: Ah, I see now. You must have met one of my sisters.

speaker: Chrom
text: Sisters? Gods, you look identical.

speaker: Anna
text: Yes, there's a strong family resemblance. Oh, and we're all traveling merchants.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...With the same name?

speaker: Anna
text: Yes, actually.

speaker: Chrom
text: Your holiday feasts must be very confusing. How do you tell each other apart?

speaker: Anna
text: Heh, that's part of the secret! Anyway, happy shopping, and may the gods of the open road keep you!

speaker: Donnel
text: Halp! You gots to help us! I’m beggin’ you, milords!

speaker: Chrom
text: Slow down. What happened?

speaker: Brigand
text: Oy! There’s the wee piglet!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Great. Bandits.

speaker: Brigand
text: What’s this? A little lording come to watch over his chattel? Haw ha—Aw, damn me! Sh-Shepherds!

speaker: Chrom
text: That’s right. So, what’ll it be? Run and live? Or fight and die?

speaker: Brigand
text: Rrgh!

speaker: Chrom
text: Quickly, lad. What happened here?

speaker: Donnel
text: Y-yes, milord! Right away, milord! ...Er, if it please Your Graciousness.

speaker: Chrom
text: Maybe just hold off on titles for now. What’s your name?

speaker: Donnel
text: Donny. Er, that is, Donnel. ...Your Majestyful. I live in the village just beyond, sir.

speaker: Chrom
text: I guess that’ll do. Now, what happened?

speaker: Donnel
text: That rotten-toothed, pig-stinkin’ bandit you just ran off attacked us! Er, pardon my language, You Lordliness. I’m the only one what got away, and even then just barely. They were roundin’ up others to haul ‘em off to a bandit camp... Please, sir! You gots to save them folks! My ma’s one of ‘em, and... She’s all I got in this world! Please, Your Royal Highness!

speaker: Chrom
text: This blasted war seems to spawn more evils by the day. All right, Donny. We’ll save your ma. Can you lead us to her?

speaker: Donnel
text: Aw, thank you, milord! Thank you! Just follow me, Your Sirness!

speaker: Roddick
text: ...And you’re sure a’this?

speaker: Brigand
text: On the grave of my sainted mother, I swear it. It was Chrom and his Shepherds, and no mistake!

speaker: Roddick
text: Heh heh heh. A fancy lord’ll fetch a high ransom from noble folk. We’ll have the little man squealin’ for mercy in no time!

speaker: Mother
text: We got nothin’ left to take, sirs! Please, let our children go!

speaker: Roddick
text: Quit yer bleatin’!

speaker: Brigand
text: Oy, Roddick! I think this cow’s the mum of the brat what ran away.

speaker: Roddick
text: ...Say, I know this one. You’re the wife of the man what broke my rib last time we were ‘ere.

speaker: Mother
text: And you killed him for it, monster! I wish he’d done for you first...

speaker: Roddick
text: Small wonder the brat’s got more brass than brains if you’re his mum. Guess we’ll see for ourselves when we catch him, eh? Maybe we’ll even make ya watch as we gut him! Bwa ha ha!

speaker: Mother
text: N-no! Please, he’s just a boy!

speaker: Donnel
text: This here’s where they’ve taken up camp, Your Lordshipness.

speaker: Chrom
text: Er...right. Thanks, Donny. Stay close, now.

speaker: Donnel
text: Beg pardon, milord? You don’t mean...? I...I can’t fight, sir! I ain’t never even stuck a pig before!

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, sorry. I just assumed... I mean... Look, just stay here. You’ll be fine.

speaker: Donnel
text: I wish I was strong as you sirs and madams! Kick that scum out single handed, I would!

speaker: Chrom
text: Then you should fight and grow stronger.

speaker: Donnel
text: But I ain’t—

speaker: Chrom
text: No man is born a warrior, Donny. And farm work makes for fine training—a sickle’s not far from a sword, after all. Bandits may be tougher than wheat, but the principle’s the same.

speaker: Donnel
text: Ngh... *sniff* A-all right, milord. As you say, I’m no warrior. But these’re my people. I gots to do what I can!

speaker: Chrom
text: Everyone in place?

speaker: Donnel
text: R-ready! *ulp*

speaker: Donnel
text: Fight and get stronger, he says... Guess it can’t hurt to try. I sure hope I don’t get in the way! Gosh, that would be just awful...

speaker: Donnel
text: I don’t think I can... go any farther... Your Majestiness...

speaker: Chrom
text: You’ve done enough, Donny! Fall back! We’ll take things from here.

speaker: Donnel
text: S-sorry...

speaker: Roddick
text: Time them castle whelps learned what us wild-born men can do!

speaker: Roddick
text: Gahaugh! Nngh...This ain't...where...

speaker: Donnel
text: We did it! We’re rid of them bandits for good and all!

speaker: Chrom
text: A worthy first victory, Donny. You fought well.

speaker: Donnel
text: Ma! Ma, it’s me!

speaker: Mother
text: Oh, Donny! Thank goodness you’re safe! I was worried near to death, boy! I can’t thank you enough for savin’ my son and our village, milord. ...Donny! Where are your manners?! Take a knee and thank His Lordness!

speaker: Donnel
text: Er, I can’t begin to repay all what you done for us, sir! Th-thank you!

speaker: Chrom
text: You led the charge, Donny. We just picked off the stragglers. Hone your potential and use it to keep this village safe.

speaker: Donnel
text: W-wait! Please!

speaker: Chrom
text: Something wrong?

speaker: Donnel
text: I has a request, sir. If it please Your Graceliness... Take me with you, milord! Lemme be a Shepherd like you! I’m good with livestock, I am! Please, sir!

speaker: Mother
text: Hush now, you fool boy!

speaker: Donnel
text: I want to hone my...whatever he said. I want to keep this place safe! I never thought I was good for nothin’ more than shovelin’ dirt... But milord showed me there’s more I can do. More I needs to be doing!

speaker: Mother
text: You needs be knowin’ your place, boy! A farmhand’s no fit for a royal—

speaker: Chrom
text: Actually, we’d be thrilled to have him. The Shepherds need every good man we can find, and your son fought bravely.

speaker: Mother
text: Y-you’re very kind to say as much, Your Lordshipness, but... *Siiigh* Well, you’re a man grown now, Donny. I s’pose you can make up your own mind.

speaker: Donnel
text: Aw, Ma...

speaker: Mother
text: ...... You just come home safe, love. I’ll see that the village is still standin’ when you return a hero. ...Well?! Off with you, then! Glory’s waiting’, boy!

speaker: Donnel
text: I ain’t fightin’ for glory, Ma. I’m fightin’ for you! But if I do find some glory, I’ll be sure to bring it home for you!

speaker: Mother
text: ...Just come home alive, Donny.

speaker: Donnel
text: Ma! Ma, it’s me!

speaker: Mother
text: Oh, Donny! Thank goodness you’re safe! I was worried near to death, boy! I can’t thank you enough for savin’ my son and our village, milord. ...Donny! Where are your manners?! Take a knee and thank His Lordness!

speaker: Donnel
text: Er, I can’t begin to repay all what you done for us, sir! Th-thank you!

speaker: Chrom
text: You did enough, Donny. And you’re young yet. In time, you’ll be defending this village single handedly.

speaker: Donnel
text: Still, I... I’m sorry I wasn’t more help, Your Princeliness.

speaker: Chrom
text: Mmm... The air is sweet here. It's so calming.

speaker: Lissa
text: Makes you want to just flop down and take a huge nap, doesn't it?

speaker: Lucina
text: Tempting...

speaker: Robin
text: Odd. It seems like anywhere else to me...

speaker: Say'Ri
text: This is Naga's Cradle. It is said the divine dragon once called this place home. Here, the Voice will enact a holy rite to commune with Naga and regain her power.

speaker: Lucina
text: Lady Tiki.

speaker: Lucina
text: ...Lady Tiki?

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Pray be silent, milady. The Voice is currently performing the rite. In doing so, she will draw the divine dragon's power from the land unto herself.

speaker: Lucina
text: Forgive me, I didn't realize. I thought she was sleeping... She looks so peaceful. What do you think she sees? Does she perchance dream?

speaker: Chrom
text: I imagine she— ...Uh-oh. Is that what I think it is? Say'ri! Lucina! Enemies approach us from the south. We'd better get ready, or the Voice here is in for a rude awakening.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: The Voice is defenseless in this state. We must become her shield until the rite is complete. We await your strategy, Robin. Make us as a wall of steel!

speaker: Say'Ri
text: Are you unharmed, Lady Tiki?

speaker: Tiki
text: Yes, thanks to you. I apologize for the delay, but the rite has borne fruit.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: You've taken in the power of the divine dragon?

speaker: Tiki
text: Some of it, yes. ...It's strange. This power had always isolated me. Many were the days I wept alone, cursing the charge placed before me...

speaker: Lucina
text: Lady Tiki...

speaker: Tiki
text: But now my power has a purpose, and the world needs it to avoid a ruinous future. And so I shall offer it freely. Allow me to join you.

speaker: Lucina
text: ...Are you certain?

speaker: Tiki
text: I am. I've had quite enough of living in solitude, thank you. Besides, I've always longed to better know this world. Now I can help you save it.

speaker: Say'Ri
text: For all the talk of power, she was a gentle soul, and far too fragile...

speaker: Chrom
text: Indeed. But I fear there's no time to grieve, Say'ri. We must keep moving. We'll try to bring her peace by securing it for the world.

speaker: Morristan
text: Send the new recruits along, then get to rounding up another half dozen or so.

speaker: Elder
text: W-wait, what are you doing?!

speaker: Morristan
text: Just what it looks like. A wyvern rider without a wyvern to sit on is just a bloke in a lizard hat.

speaker: Elder
text: Wyverns are the sacred protectors of this land, not glorified horses to be muzzled!

speaker: Morristan
text: I'd muzzle you, had I the time. As it stands, I'll take a quicker path to quiet. G'night!

speaker: Elder
text: Gwargh!

speaker: Villager
text: N-no...! Run!

speaker: Soldier
text: Your orders, sir?

speaker: Morristan
text: If word spreads, it'll only get more tedious. Sooo...yes. Better just kill everyone.

speaker: Chrom
text: Where does this road lead?

speaker: Frederick
text: To Wyvern Valley, milord. Home to Valm's greatest feral wyvern population.

speaker: Chrom
text: That sounds...interesting. We'll have to be sure and keep our distance.

speaker: Cherche
text: Shame. My Minerva's fit to burst. She's excited others of her kind are near.

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh? She doesn't look that excited to me. Not that I can really tell the difference...

speaker: Cherche
text: Oh, it's easy. She just looks even cuter than normal. Don't you, girl? Don't you look cuter? Who's a goooood wyvern?!

speaker: Chrom
text: I'll, uh...leave you to her, then.

speaker: Villager
text: Sir, over here! Please help! My friends will die if you don't!

speaker: Villager
text: Wh-what?! But, sir, my friends!

speaker: Gerome
text: I'm not fit to fight for anyone.

speaker: Villager
text: Th-then...they're lost...

speaker: Chrom
text: You there! What's happened?

speaker: Villager
text: My people are fleeing for their lives from a pack of armed brigands, sir! And now we've gotten separated... Oh, the horror of it all!

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, today's your lucky day. We'll aid you and your friends.

speaker: Villager
text: You will?! Oh, thank you! Please, sir! Give 'em what for!

speaker: Cherche
text: Wait. You're not one of the villagers.

speaker: Gerome
text: No. ...I am Gerome. A traveler.

speaker: Cherche
text: And a fellow wyvern rider, I see. This is a piece of good news! We fight to keep these villagers alive. Will you aid us?

speaker: Gerome
text: Why? No man can stop fate.

speaker: Cherche
text: These people will be killed by spears, traveler. Not fate.

speaker: Gerome
text: Heh. Spoken like one who has yet to witness fate's implacable cruelty.

speaker: Cherche
text: So you do nothing, then, save wandering the land in the fog of cowardice? And your wyvern? Has she seen enough? Does she also yearn to surrender?

speaker: Gerome
text: ...... You would know better than I.

speaker: Cherche
text: What does that mean?

speaker: Gerome
text: Nothing. I'll fight if you wish it. Death will always have its due, but perhaps it will accept a few substitutions. Come, my dear Minerva. Join me on one final flight...

speaker: Chrom
text: Are you with the villagers? Who are you?

speaker: Gerome
text: ...I am Gerome. A traveler.

speaker: Chrom
text: These people are in desperate straits. Will you help us?

speaker: Gerome
text: It is not for me to interfere in such matters. Death will always have its due.

speaker: Chrom
text: You would leave innocents to die and lay the blame on fate?

speaker: Gerome
text: I've seen too much of fate's cruel work to doubt it.

speaker: Chrom
text: So you would surrender rather than struggle against such cruelty... I cannot understand such thinking. A bleak past doesn't justify condemning the future to bleakness as well. Nonetheless, I cannot force your hand. Join us if you will.

speaker: Gerome
text: What does he know of bleak futures? It is a fool who breaks himself against fate's tide. That said, I suppose I'm as big a fool as any... *sigh* Very well, then. Come, my dear Minerva. Join me on one final flight...

speaker: Gerome
text: Death...always has its...due... Go, Minerva... Be...free...

speaker: Morristan
text: Seems these newcomers have spine. Send word to the boys at the hold. Tell 'em we've got spines that need breaking.

speaker: Morristan
text: Wyvern or man, everyone's all snarl and fire until they learn the feel of the lash!

speaker: Villager
text: Our saviors! And it's more than lives you rescued... You've saved my hope in humanity, too. I thank you for it. Here, sir. A token of my gratitude

speaker: Chrom
text: Thanks to you as well, friend.

speaker: Villager
text: Take care, now. We'll pray for a safe journey for you and your troops.

speaker: Cherche
text: Do you have a moment?

speaker: Gerome
text: What is it?

speaker: Cherche
text: I was hoping you might introduce me to your wyvern.

speaker: Gerome
text: Why?

speaker: Cherche
text: To see which of ours is cuter. Not very sporting of me when mine is the finest in the world, I know.

speaker: Gerome
text: ...Do as you please.

speaker: Cherche
text: I will, then! Thank you. ...... ...Hee hee! Oh, but you ARE cute! She's nearly a match with Minerva! ...Nearly so in every way. Wait, what sorcery is this? They...they look IDENTICAL!

speaker: Gerome
text: That's because they are identical. They're one and the same.

speaker: Cherche
text: ...M-Minerva? How is that possible?

speaker: Gerome
text: You could examine her from tip to tail looking for scars and marks if you like. ...Or you could just look at this ring.

speaker: Cherche
text: I...I know that ring. So then you're...

speaker: Gerome
text: I am, though I had not intended that we meet.

speaker: Cherche
text: Why not?

speaker: Gerome
text: I came back in time so I might release Minerva. Not to seek out parents to whom I've already bidden farewell.

speaker: Cherche
text: You crossed the bounds of time just to set Minerva free? Whatever for?!

speaker: Gerome
text: In the future I know, she is among the last of her kind. I...I could not leave her to that solitude.

speaker: Cherche
text: She is lucky indeed to know someone of such kindness. ...As, I imagine, am I.

speaker: Gerome
text: Stay your words. I've no intention of getting close to you. Fate will not be mocked. This war may claim your life anew, and I'll not weep twice for losing the same mother. My burden is heavy enough.

speaker: Cherche
text: But yet you carry it still.

speaker: Gerome
text: That's enough.

speaker: Cherche
text: Thank you, Gerome.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Dishonorable cur! You killed my master, and now you will face me!

speaker: Cassius
text: If that pile of pudding was your master, I'd advise you to just keep walking.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Craven dog... You claimed a hostage! He'd never have lost in a fair fight!

speaker: Maiden
text: Nor would he have wanted this, Kjelle. If I lose you as well, I...

speaker: Kjelle
text: You won't lose me. I swear it. And I swear your husband will be avenged!

speaker: Cassius
text: If you want to run headlong into the grave, girl, I won't stop you. We can duel in the ruins ahead.

speaker: Robin
text: What do you make of this, Chrom?

speaker: Chrom
text: I hope she knows what she's getting into.

speaker: Maiden
text: Sir! Please! You have to do something!

speaker: Chrom
text: What's the matter?

speaker: Maiden
text: It's my friend, sir. I fear she's walking into a terrible trap! That scoundrel Cassius would never fight an honest duel. My husband took a similar stand against his tyranny not long ago. The brute took a girl hostage and then cut my husband down as he lowered his weapon! *Sniff* I can't let her suffer the same fate... I'd die, I would!

speaker: Chrom
text: All right. We'll see what we can do.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Coward! You promised me a duel, you soulless blackheart!

speaker: Cassius
text: Indeed I did. Consider all these men my seconds, heh. Still, I'm not a monster. I'll spare your life if you get on your knees and beg.

speaker: Kjelle
text: I'd sooner die!

speaker: Cassius
text: Well, we can arrange that, too. Have at her, boys!

speaker: Sully
text: Hey. You got a second?

speaker: Kjelle
text: Ahh!

speaker: Sully
text: What? I got something on my face?

speaker: Kjelle
text: N-no, you just...remind me of someone. Forgive me. I have no time to talk.

speaker: Sully
text: Don't worry. It won't take long. So listen. These lowlifes have no honour. You know that, right? If you meet 'em head-on, you'll just end up with a sword in your back.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Head-on is how I live.

speaker: Sully
text: ...Ooh, I like you. And that's all the more reason I can't let you charge off on your own.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Don't try to stop me!

speaker: Sully
text: I'm not stopping you. I'm coming with you. You just focus on finishing your duel, and I'll kill any idiot who gets in the way.

speaker: Kjelle
text: R-right!

speaker: Chrom
text: Excuse me—

speaker: Kjelle
text: Wha—?! Die, fiend! Y-you parried my spear. ...How did you do that?

speaker: Chrom
text: I get a lot of practice. Now can you please stop trying to skewer me for a second? We're not your enemies. A friend sent us to help you. There are too many for you to fight alone, no matter your skill. We'll take care of the rabble while you fight your duel.

speaker: Kjelle
text: You would do this for a stranger?

speaker: Chrom
text: Is that a problem?

speaker: Kjelle
text: N-no, of course not. Thank you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Excuse me—

speaker: Kjelle
text: Wha—?! Die, fiend! Y-you parried my spear. But how did you... Wait. Do I know you? I feel as if we've met, but... No, that's impossible.

speaker: Chrom
text: I hate to interrupt your musing, but could you perhaps lower your spear? We've been sent here to help you. They are too many for you to fight alone. We'll take care of the rabble while you fight your duel.

speaker: Kjelle
text: You would do this for a stranger?

speaker: Chrom
text: Is that a problem?

speaker: Kjelle
text: N-no, of course not. Thank you.

speaker: Cassius
text: Most people think a man who fights dirty is too weak to win otherwise. Heh heh... Suits me just fine. A cocky fool is an easy target!

speaker: Kjelle
text: If you believe in gods, you'd better pray to them now!

speaker: Cassius
text: My, my. Aren't we confident?

speaker: Kjelle
text: I don't fear you, coward!

speaker: Cassius
text: Aye, I suppose not. Most fools assume that liars and sneaks like me are weak. They want us to be weak, see? They NEED it. It lets them hold on to the fantasy that right prevails in the end. Heh... They can think what they want. A cocky fool is an easy target. Truth is, in the end, it's the clever ones who always survive.

speaker: Kjelle
text: A man who takes hostages in order to win a duel has no claim to cleverness. Even an animal would not stoop so low! But enough. I've no more words to waste on the likes of you. My master will have vengeance!

speaker: Cassius
text: Wrong, girl. Your master will have COMPANY!

speaker: Maiden
text: Kjelle! Thank the gods you're safe!

speaker: Kjelle
text: I kept my promise. Your husband can rest in peace now.

speaker: Maiden
text: I may have a way to thank you. This was his, and I'm sure he would have wanted you to have it.

speaker: Kjelle
text: This is a precious keepsake. Its rightful place is with you.

speaker: Maiden
text: I'll not forget my husband for lack of a memento, dear. Now please, take it.

speaker: Kjelle
text: You're certain?

speaker: Maiden
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Then...thank you.

speaker: Maiden
text: Just swear to take care of yourself, Kjelle. Swear you'll stay safe.

speaker: Kjelle
text: I swear it.

speaker: Sully
text: Looks like the good guys won after all. Ain't that a kick in the teeth?

speaker: Kjelle
text: Thank you for your help, but I fear other tasks yet lie ahead of me. I still have to find my parents.

speaker: Sully
text: Aw, hell. Your parents are missing? That's rough, kid. Any idea where they might have gone?

speaker: Kjelle
text: I have a ring my father gave my mother, but precious little else to go on.

speaker: Sully
text: Mind if I take a look?

speaker: Kjelle
text: No, of course not.

speaker: Sully
text: Well, I'll be damned... Kid? This is MY ring.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Your ring? But then...

speaker: Sully
text: Hah! I get it. You're one of the kids who came back with Lucina, yeah? Which means...I've got a new lead for you on the parent front, kiddo. ...I'm your mom.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Y-you?!

speaker: Sully
text: You expecting someone prettier?

speaker: Kjelle
text: N-no! Of course not! I mean... You look as beautiful now as when I knew you.

speaker: Sully
text: Har! So I'm not all wrinkled or missing a hand or anything? That's a relief.

speaker: Kjelle
text: You were a beautiful and vibrant woman, despite the ill times we lived in. You taught me how to be strong. You taught me to survive.

speaker: Sully
text: All right, kid, sit down. I want to know every last detail about the future.

speaker: Kjelle
text: You bet!

speaker: Sully
text: ...Is that how you address you mother?

speaker: Kjelle
text: I mean, y-yes! Yes ma'am!

speaker: Sully
text: Much better.

speaker: Kjelle
text: Hee hee. You always were tough on me.

speaker: Sully
text: That's right. Any child of mine is gonna have to learn to respect their elders!

speaker: Kjelle
text: ...It's good to see you, Mother.

speaker: Ezra
text: All alone are you lamb? Off searching for dear old mum? How very sweet. But the world's a dangerous place my dear, full of wolves waiting to snatch you up.

speaker: Noire
text: Um... th-thank you for the warning, sir, b-but...

speaker: Ezra
text: That's no warning, lamb. I'm a wolf, and you've been snatched! Now come quietly. Scars tend to lower the sale price.

speaker: Frederick
text: Slavers, milord. Such damnable scum...

speaker: Chrom
text: We'll have to hurry if we hope to catch them.

speaker: Tharja
text: Or we could stay here and just let me go to work on them. A curse to wither them away, perhaps? A slow death over a year? Oh, fie. Let's make it two.

speaker: Chrom
text: I think their captive would likely appreciate something a bit more immediate. Shepherds! Saving the girl is our top priority! Now move out!

speaker: Noire
text: It's over... My life is over... Mother, I'll be by your side soon...

speaker: Noire
text: So this is how it ends... Killed... or worse. A clean death would be a mercy compared to what awaits... Huh? What's this? An old bow? Hmm, the string's still taut. I suppose I could use this to try and fight my way out. B-but those bandits are so strong and scary and... W-wait! My talisman! Let me just grab my talisman and then... ...... ...I AM THE FIRE AND FURY! ALL WHO DEFY ME WILL PERISH! REPENT, SCUM! REPENT THOUGH IT WILL SAVE YOU NOT! REPENT AND DESPAIR! BWAAA HA HA HA HA!

speaker: Noire
text: Oh, thank you! Thank you so much! Had you not saved me, I... I fear to even think what would have happened...

speaker: Chrom
text: It's all right, take it easy. No one's going to hurt you now.

speaker: Noire
text: *Sniff* P-please, sir... Let me come with you. There's someone I need to talk to, but I'm s-scared to be alone...

speaker: Tharja
text: What do you want?

speaker: Noire
text: I, um... I mean... Er... H-here, please look at this.

speaker: Tharja
text: Nice ring. Looks just like mine. You messing around with alchemy? Or is this something... darker?

speaker: Noire
text: Wha--? N-no! It's nothing of the sort! It's just...

speaker: Tharja
text: Tell me the truth, girl. You don't want to see what happens if you lie to me.

speaker: Noire
text: P-please, just give me... I n-need a moment... M-my talisman... Wh-where is my talisman... ......

speaker: Noire
text: I AM BLOOD AND THUNDER! I AM A RIGHTEOUS FURY! ...I AM YOUR FUTURE DAUGHTER!

speaker: Tharja
text: You are trying my patience.

speaker: Noire
text: INSOLENCE! I speak the truth! The ring I bear also hails from the future. A memento of you, my departed mother!

speaker: Tharja
text: And that bizarre talisman?

speaker: Noire
text: Your own handiwork! Wrought to steel the mewling heart of your coward daughter! In its strength did I find blessed escape from grief and solitude! Fear of death and killing, too, it drove from me, until I became an avatar of retribution! Only by clinging to it have I survived the crushing desolation of a ruinated future! BWAA HA HA HA HA!

speaker: Tharja
text: Oh, give me that.

speaker: Noire
text: Um, w-wait! I need that! Without it, I can't--

speaker: Tharja
text: Survive? You can and will. And not by becoming some avatar of retribution. Just be my daughter. Leave the retribution to me.

speaker: Noire
text: M-Mother...

speaker: Tharja
text: My, this is a nasty little number. The future me is good. ...And very, very bad. Hee hee. I can't wait.

speaker: Noire
text: M-Mother, you're f-frightening me! ...A-again!

speaker: Tharja
text: This little trinket will advance my research in the dark arts nicely... Hmm... You have my blood, right? I'm going to need a bit of it back.

speaker: Noire
text: Aaaaiiieee! I... I mean... BLEED ME DRY AND I SHALL BE AS THUNDER STILL!

speaker: Tharja
text: See. No daughter of mine needs some mummer's prop to be strong. Hee... Hee hee...

speaker: Noire
text: BWAAA HA HA HA HA!

speaker: Tharja
text: Eee hee hee hee hee!

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, this is just wonderful...

speaker: Nah
text: All right, Nah... You can do this.You're strong! You're brave! You... EEEEEEK! Ha ha...haaaaa... Just a statue. Nothing to be afraid of...

speaker: Nah
text: AAAAAH! What the heck is that?!  *Huff, huff* ...Wait a minute, this is silly. I can turn into a dragon... What am I worried about? Now how do I get out of this wretched place?

speaker: Chrom
text: Did anyone else hear a girl scream? Come on, Shepherds! Hurry!

speaker: Nah
text: Eeeeeek!

speaker: Chrom
text: Wait! I'm a friend! We're here to help.

speaker: Nah
text: Whew, good thing you spoke up there... I was about to melt you with my breath.

speaker: Chrom
text: Huh? Your breath seems fine to me...? ...Oh. I get it. You're a manakete. So perhaps you'd like to tell me your name?

speaker: Nah
text: Nah.

speaker: Chrom
text: Look, if I somehow offended you, I apologize. But you could at least-

speaker: Nah
text: No, NAH. N-A-H. That's my name. Ugh, why does this always happen...

speaker: Chrom
text: Er, right. Let's discuss it later, okay? For now, just stay behind me.

speaker: Nah
text: Behind you? I can turn into a dragon, you know. I'm pretty strong.

speaker: Chrom
text: Dragonkin or no, you're still a child, and I won't have you taking unnecessary risks. Now let's get you out of here.

speaker: Nah
text: Stern, aren't you? Fair enough. I like your attitude. Lead the way, sir. I'm right behind you.

speaker: Nowi
text: Ooh, you're the little girl we're looking for!

speaker: Nah
text: It takes one to know one...

speaker: Nowi
text: Ha-hah! It may look that way, but I'm actually quite old. I'm a dragonkin!

speaker: Nah
text: Oh? Well so am I, actua- Wait, are you Nowi?

speaker: Nowi
text: Wow, nice guess!

speaker: Nah
text: It IS you!

speaker: Nowi
text: All right, I've told you my name. Now you tell me yours.

speaker: Nah
text: Nah.

speaker: Nowi
text: Oh, come on, why not?!

speaker: Nah
text: No, NAH. N-A-H. That's my name.

speaker: Nowi
text: That's a confusing name...

speaker: Nah
text: And whose fault is that?!

speaker: Nowi
text: How the heck should I know? Anyway, this place isn't safe. Let's get you out of here!

speaker: Nah
text: After you...

speaker: Nah
text: Thank you so much. If you hadn't have come, I'd have been an adorable smear on the wall by now...

speaker: Chrom
text: Can you make it home on your own?

speaker: Nah
text: I... I don't have a home. Not anymore.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then I'll arrange one for you in Ylisse.

speaker: Nah
text: No, my place is here with you now. I'm strong enough to fight, you know.

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, seeing as you're a manakete, I certainly don't doubt that... Look, if you're sure this is what you want, then we'd love to have you.

speaker: Nah
text: I'm sure. And thank you. You won't regret it.

speaker: Nah
text: Can I ask you something, Nowi? Does this look familiar?

speaker: Nowi
text: Whoa, you have the same ring as me! What a crazy coincidence!

speaker: Nah
text: It's not a coincidence. This is your ring. It's a memento of my mother. From... the future. It keeps me safe, now that... Now that you're gone.

speaker: Nowi
text: Nah...

speaker: Nah
text: No, I'm serious. It does.

speaker: Nowi
text: Huh? Oh, hee hee! You did it to yourself that time! But no, I think it's very sweet. And now that you're with me, you don't have to hold back.

speaker: Nah
text: I wasn't holding back. I fought as hard as I could...

speaker: Nowi
text: No, you fought brilliantly, Nah. But that's not what I meant. I was talking about your tears. If you're sad, you can talk to me.

speaker: Nah
text: No, I... I have to be strong. Everyone expects me to. I can turn into a dragon, you know? And that's not... normal. So I have to put on a brave face and protect everyone, just like you do.

speaker: Nowi
text: Your mother cries all the time, dear. ...Aaaaaall the time. Trust me on this—holding things back won't make you stronger. Just be you, Nah. That's enough.

speaker: Nah
text: I... This whole time, I...

speaker: Nowi
text: I know it's been pretty scary, but you made it through!

speaker: Nah
text: *Sniff* Mother, I... Oh, it was awful... I thought I was going to DIE... *Sob* Waaaaaah!

speaker: Nowi
text: *Sniff* It... it's okay, Nah. Mother's here, now.

speaker: Robin
text: Quite the bustling little town.

speaker: Chrom
text: The harvest must've just come in. I wager there's some good eating to be had!

speaker: Lissa
text: Count me in! It's been DAYS since I had a proper meal!

speaker: Villager
text: Welcome to the Grub Sh-ACK! Y-you're... You're...

speaker: Villager
text: T-terribly sorry, sir, but we're closed!

speaker: Chrom
text: That was...odd. I guess we'll try elsewhere.

speaker: Lucina
text: This place looks open, Father. ...Ooh, they have pottage!

speaker: Maiden
text: Eeek!

speaker: Lucina
text: Hmm?

speaker: Maiden
text: P-please, not again! We'll be ruined! This tavern is all we have! Mercy, sirs! Leave us in peace!

speaker: Chrom
text: People here don't seem to like us very much.

speaker: Frederick
text: I did a little investigating on that front, milord. It seems a band of nasty rogues have been harrying them without pause for some time. Apparently, they are led by a man who masquerades as...you.

speaker: Chrom
text: *Sigh* So that's what this is about. Any idea where they are?

speaker: Frederick
text: It seems they headed north, milord.

speaker: Chrom
text: Then so shall we.

speaker: Ruger
text: Heh heh... Another fine haul. Long live the great Chrom!

speaker: Cynthia
text: Chrom? Father? Faaather? Pegasus Knight Cynthia, returned from patrol, sir! ...Whoops!  Ooh... Right on the face... S-sorry for my clumsiness, sir! I promise not to trip again for at least 24 hours!

speaker: Ruger
text: That'd be a new record... Now out with it, girl! What'd you see?

speaker: Cynthia
text: A suspicious band of travelers have been making inquiries in town, sir.

speaker: Ruger
text: Oh?

speaker: Cynthia
text: They call their leader Chrom, sir. I suspect they are impostors posing as you! They must be stopped at once, Father!

speaker: Ruger
text: Cynthia, what did I say about calling me that around the men?

speaker: Cynthia
text: S-sorry, Father! I mean, Chrom! Milord! ...It won't happen again.

speaker: Ruger
text: Your mind's near as slippery as your feet... Anyway, we, uh, don't have the men to battle this impostor right now. Best swallow our pride and exercise the better part of valor for now.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Levelheaded and humble as ever, sir! Allow me to draw their attention while you retreat to safety!

speaker: Ruger
text: Yes, yes, of course. A fine plan.

speaker: Cynthia
text: I won't let you down, sir!

speaker: Ruger
text: ...... ...Gads, she's dumb as a brick. Good thing her spear is sharper than her wit. Still, at least she stopped ranting about hailing from the future...

speaker: Ruger
text: Heh heh... Another fine haul. Long live the great Chrom!

speaker: Cynthia
text: Chrom? Sir? Pegasus Knight Cynthia, returned from patrol, sir! ...Whoops!  Oof... Right on the face... S-sorry for my clumsiness, sir! I promise not to trip again for at least 24 hours!

speaker: Ruger
text: That'd be a new record... Now out with it, girl! What did you see?

speaker: Cynthia
text: A suspicious band of travelers have been making inquiries in town, sir.

speaker: Ruger
text: Oh?

speaker: Cynthia
text: They call their leader Chrom, sir. I suspect they are impostors posing as you! They must be stopped at once!

speaker: Ruger
text: Er, riiight. Posing as...me. But, uh, we don't have the men to battle these impostors right now. Best swallow our pride and exercise the better part of valor for now.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Levelheaded and humble as ever, sir! Allow me to draw their attention while you retreat to safety!

speaker: Ruger
text: Yes, yes, of course. A fine plan.

speaker: Cynthia
text: I won't let you down, sir!

speaker: Ruger
text: ...... Gads, she's dumb as a brick. ...Still, full marks for enthusiasm.

speaker: Chrom
text: And you are...?

speaker: Cynthia
text: All who would pretend to Chrom's name will answer to me for their deceit! Lay down your arms and surrender, or face judgement at my spear!

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, she certainly seems eager. What do you think, Robin? If she's being honestly deceived, we may be able to show her the truth.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Enough! In the name of my lord Chrom, cast down your sword or draw it!

speaker: Ruger
text: Hmm? A band of mercenaries? Luck smiles on me today! A few pretty lies, and I'll have the lot of 'em fighting for me!

speaker: Ruger
text: Haaalp! I am Chrom, ruler of Ylisse! I'm being hunted by brigands! If you help me, I'll see to it that you're handsomely rewarded!

speaker: Ruger
text: Hold fast until I give the word. The moment they clear that rubble, fall on them like an avalanche!

speaker: Ruger
text: Still not coming, are you? Then the initiative will be ours!

speaker: Sumia
text: Pardon me, but...I think you may be misinformed. Can we speak a moment?

speaker: Cynthia
text: Don't waste your breath! Your lies ring hollow! Your...ring? ...Ring? Y-your RING! MOTHER!

speaker: Sumia
text: ...What?

speaker: Cynthia
text: It is you! Oh, Mother, you're alive! I never thought I'd see you again! I...I... *sniff* Waaaaaaaaaah!

speaker: Sumia
text: Um...are you all right?

speaker: Cynthia
text: WAIT! But if you're on that side, that means... Ohmigosh. My Chrom is a FAKE! Oh, I am going to KILL him for this! I'm going to plant a flying hoof right in his stupid liar face!

speaker: Sumia
text: Wait! We really should... Well, at least she's not confused anymore. If only I could say the same for me...

speaker: Chrom
text: Still your spear a moment and hear me out. You've been lied to!

speaker: Cynthia
text: Spare me your tales, brigand! I have nothing to say to someone who would impersonate my mother's dearest friend!

speaker: Chrom
text: Your...mother?

speaker: Cynthia
text: You heard me! How dare you besmirch my mother Sumia's name!

speaker: Chrom
text: And it all becomes clear... Well, welcome to the past.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Wha—?! But how could you know?

speaker: Chrom
text: That you came from the future? Lucina told me all about it.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Lucy's here?!

speaker: Chrom
text: In the flesh.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Then...you're the real Chrom?

speaker: Chrom
text: Last I checked.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Ugh, I'm so sorry! I've always been gullible, ever since I was a little girl, but... Hey! This means the other Chrom LIED! Oh, I'm going to kill him for this! I'm going to plant a flying hoof right in his stupid liar face!

speaker: Chrom
text: Still your spear a moment and hear me out. You've been lied to!

speaker: Cynthia
text: Spare me your tales, brigand! I've nothing to say to someone who would impersonate my father!

speaker: Chrom
text: Your what? Oh, for the love of... How many daughters are going to come back in time to see me?

speaker: Cynthia
text: Huh? H-how did you know I-

speaker: Chrom
text: I already went through this with Lucina.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Lucy's here?!

speaker: Chrom
text: In the flesh. ...Though she neglected to mention she had a sister.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Wait—then you really are...! Oh, Father! I missed you SOOOOO MUUUCH!

speaker: Chrom
text: My... my ears...

speaker: Cynthia
text: I knew something was fishy with that guy! He barely even smiled when I found him. My REAL father would've given me a big hug and called me his little pega-pony princess!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Please tell me I never actually say that.

speaker: Cynthia
text: You'll say it right now, if you want me to believe you're the real Chrom!

speaker: Chrom
text: Uh... It's... it's good to see you, my... Um... My little pega-pony princess...

speaker: Cynthia
text: Aww, it's good to see you too, Father! I can't believe I fell for that lying creep's lies! Oh, I am going to KILL him for this! I'm going to plant a flying hoof right in his stupid liar face!

speaker: Chrom
text: She's even flightier than her mother. ...I didn't think that was possible.

speaker: Ruger
text: I'm not dying in a backwater like this! I'll take what's handy and then take off!

speaker: Chrom
text: That’s the last of them.

speaker: Frederick
text: We can explain the truth to those mercenaries as we tend their wounds. Frankly, I’m shocked that scoundrel had the audacity to impersonate you, milord.

speaker: Chrom
text: Not the worst of his crimes, I’m sure.

speaker: Frederick
text: It is unacceptable, milord. I have clearly failed in my duties as a knight. I shall draft a series of portraits and see that copies are distributed to all! Never again shall someone mistake the noble visage of my lord Chrom for—

speaker: Chrom
text: Frederick. Let’s just go.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Do you have a moment, Sumia?

speaker: Sumia
text: Oh, hello. You’re the girl from...before. Er...

speaker: Cynthia
text: Cynthia! My name is Cynthia!

speaker: Sumia
text: What a darling name.

speaker: Cynthia
text: Tee hee! I KNOW! I’ve always loved it. It was a gift from my mother. ...From you.

speaker: Sumia
text: What? Me? But I... I’ve never seen...

speaker: Cynthia
text: Oh, but you WILL! Isn’t that great?! I came from the FUTURE, Mother! See? Our rings match up and everything! It’s ‘cause you gave it to me! Or you will. I mean, later. Before I come back here, but after I... Gods, this is confusing!

speaker: Sumia
text: You...you’re my daughter...?

speaker: Cynthia
text: I sure am! I missed you so, Mother. Come here. Give me a hug— Whoops!  Ooh. That one’s gonna bruise... Er, don’t worry about me. I’m fine!

speaker: Sumia
text: ...Well, we’re definitely related. Hold on. You dropped something. ...A spearhead?

speaker: Cynthia
text: S-sorry! I’ll take that back!

speaker: Sumia
text: Why are you carrying that around?

speaker: Cynthia
text: Because it hasn’t been made yet. You promised me we’d make it together.

speaker: Sumia
text: I did?

speaker: Cynthia
text: But you broke your promise the day... The day you never came home. How could you leave me, Mother? You were a legend! You were invincible!

speaker: Sumia
text: Wait, are you saying I...died? I’m so sorry, love. I guess I’m not much of a legend after all.

speaker: Cynthia
text: ...You are to me.

speaker: Sumia
text: ...I may not be invincible, but at least I was blessed with a wonderful child. Had we decided what sort of haft to give the spear? We can pick up the materials in the next town.

speaker: Cynthia
text: W-we can?

speaker: Sumia
text: I made a promise, didn’t I?

speaker: Cynthia
text: *sniff* Oh...oh, Mother... I love you!

speaker: Villager
text: This can't go on, Elder! We barely have enough to get us by as it is!

speaker: Elder
text: Their leader is a former Valmese general! We'll be crushed if we resist...

speaker: Chrom
text: What's that about Valm?

speaker: Villager
text: Who are you?

speaker: Chrom
text: My name is Chrom.

speaker: Elder
text: The ruler of Ylisse?!

speaker: Villager
text: Elder! He may be able to help us!

speaker: Chrom
text: Um, I can hear you. But tell me your problem, and I'll see what I can do.

speaker: Elder
text: Oh, thank you, sir!

speaker: Soldier
text: Urgent news, sir! Armed soldiers approach! Their leader claims to be Chrom of Ylisse!

speaker: Nelson
text: Dammit! Why would he come here? Well, if they insist on dogging me, I've got hounds of my own to welcome them with.

speaker: Severa
text: I'm not your dog, scum!

speaker: Nelson
text: No, only a stray mutt that refuses to stop yapping. But you'll be a good dog and do as I say if you ever want--

speaker: Severa
text: Yes, yes, if I ever want to see it again. I'm well aware.

speaker: Nelson
text: I trust you're equally aware of your position, Holland?

speaker: Nelson
text: Loquacious as ever, I see. You'll fight for me, or I'll have that lazy tongue pried from your head. Now, then, Chrom may have the Fire Emblem in his possession... And if I claim that, I've practically claimed the throne. So go out there, kill anything that moves, and get me that Emblem!

speaker: Chrom
text: Looks like this is the castle the villagers told us about. Let's reclaim what's been stolen and return it to the villagers.

speaker: Severa
text: All this grief over something so small... Once I get what I came for, I'm out of here. Maybe I can convince Holland to come with me.

speaker: Severa
text: ...Oh, gods. It's you.

speaker: Cordelia
text: Have we met? If so, I'm afraid I've quite forgotten.

speaker: Severa
text: Well, excuse me for being so forgettable!

speaker: Cordelia
text: Look, there's no time for this. If you're a friend, speak now. If not, then stay out of Chrom's way or I'll have to cut you down.

speaker: Severa
text: Chrom, Chrom, Chrom! It's ALWAYS Chrom with you!

speaker: Cordelia
text: ...I'm sorry?

speaker: Severa
text: You should be! And I don't care about your stupid Chrom, so you can just drop it! ...I only want to talk to Holland.

speaker: Cordelia
text: Holland?

speaker: Severa
text: Yes, Holland! That sad sack over there. Watch my back so I can get to him safely, and then I'll help your stupid army!

speaker: Cordelia
text: O...okay?

speaker: Severa
text: Oh, and Holland's not here of his own will, so don't you dare hurt him!

speaker: Chrom
text: What's a child doing here?

speaker: Severa
text: Child? I'm not a child, you oaf! I'm... Wait, are you the enemy general?

speaker: Chrom
text: I don't know. Are we enemies?

speaker: Severa
text: You're Chrom, aren't you? You're Lucina's father.

speaker: Chrom
text: That's right. ...And I suppose you came back here with my daughter?

speaker: Severa
text: Oh, good. Now I won't have to waste time explaining the situation. ...Weird. I didn't think you'd be so funny looking.

speaker: Chrom
text: You're a real charmer. But charm or not, if you can fight, you're welcome to join our cause.

speaker: Severa
text: Not the snappiest pick-up line I've heard, but I suppose it gets the job done. But I can't leave until I reclaim my property from Nelson. We'll talk then.

speaker: Chrom
text: Actually, we're here to take stolen goods back to the village. If I promise to add yours to the list, will that persuade you?

speaker: Severa
text: Mmm... Maybe. But you'll have to help my friend Holland, too. He's a bit of a sad sack, but he doesn't want to be here either.

speaker: Chrom
text: Will he listen to reason?

speaker: Severa
text: He will if I talk to him. He listens to pretty much whatever I say. Don't worry, he hates Nelson, too. Just be sure not to hurt him.

speaker: Chrom
text: We'll be careful.

speaker: Severa
text: Holland, no! You idiot! Now you'll never get to see your wife again or meet your new child... I guess I shouldn't be surprised. Families never stay together...

speaker: Severa
text: Holland!

speaker: Holland
text: Severa! What are you doing here? If he knows you left your post...

speaker: Severa
text: I'm leaving, Holland, and you're coming with me.

speaker: Holland
text: Severa, I... I can't. You know I can't. I have a wife. If I don't earn Nelson's coin, she'll starve. I know it's blood money, but--

speaker: Severa
text: Your wife is PREGNANT, Holland! You know that, don't you?!

speaker: Holland
text: Of course I know that! And it's none of your concern!

speaker: Severa
text: Do you love your child, Holland? Do you love your wife?

speaker: Holland
text: Of course I do!

speaker: Severa
text: Then stop making excuses! I know that parents will do anything for their children... But I also know how it feels when a child loses her parents. This world's got far too many kids who've gone through that. If you stay, you'll be killed or worse. And your child deserves better!

speaker: Holland
text: Severa, I... I'm sorry. I didn't know. That must have been hard for you. ...... You're right. My child deserves better. Let's get out of here.

speaker: Severa
text: Really?!

speaker: Holland
text: Yes, really. But we have to hurry!

speaker: Nelson
text: What are those useless fools doing?! Get them! Somebody get them!

speaker: Nelson
text: Damn... Useless fools, all of you!

speaker: Chrom
text: And what does that make the man cowering behind them?

speaker: Nelson
text: Bah! I'll use your corpse to clean the blood from my boots!

speaker: Nelson
text: Traitorous wench!

speaker: Severa
text: You've got to be loyal before you can be a traitor, you idiot! And you're one to talk, extorting a poor innocent girl like me...it's time you learned just how deadly this innocent girl can be!

speaker: Elder
text: You've saved the village from starvation! You're a true hero of the people, sir.

speaker: Severa
text: Yes, here it is!

speaker: Chrom
text: Is that a ring?

speaker: Severa
text: It's my ring, and I'll thank you to stop staring so lustily at it! It's worth more to me than anything in the world to me... That rat Nelson stole it one night while I was sleeping.

speaker: Chrom
text: Well, I'm glad you were able to get it back.

speaker: Severa
text: ...Hmph.

speaker: Cordelia
text: Oh. ...You.

speaker: Severa
text: Wh-what do you want?!

speaker: Cordelia
text: Just to thank you for helping us. You fought bravely, er...

speaker: Severa
text: Severa. ...My name's Severa.

speaker: Cordelia
text: It suits you somehow. Oh, and my name--

speaker: Severa
text: Cordelia. I know.

speaker: Cordelia
text: Er, yes, that's... But how did you...? I'm sorry, did I introduce myself before?

speaker: Severa
text: I guess you must have if I know your name. Gods...

speaker: Cordelia
text: I... I see. Well, thank you all the same, Severa.

speaker: Severa
text: You already said that! And besides, it's not like I did anything special. I was just fighting to get back what's rightfully mine.

speaker: Cordelia
text: Are you referring to that ring? Oh, goodness. It looks exactly like... Ah I see. That would explain how you know my name. You're a friend of Lucina's, aren't you? ...And you're my child. Isn't that right?

speaker: Severa
text: *Mutter* *grumble* ...lonely...

speaker: Cordelia
text: What was that?

speaker: Severa
text: I SAID, I thought you'd might be lonely, so I came here to see you! ...You're welcome.

speaker: Cordelia
text: That's very sweet.

speaker: Severa
text: D-don't mock me! You don't care! You don't care at all!

speaker: Cordelia
text: How could you possibly think that? I'm thrilled beyond words to meet you.

speaker: Severa
text: ...Then why'd you leave me? You said you had to go off to fight for what really mattered, and you never came back! You picked Chrom over me!

speaker: Cordelia
text: You have me at a disadvantage, Severa. I can't answer for my future self. But when I said I was fighting for what mattered, I probably meant you. I'd want nothing more than to build a world where you could grow up happy and strong. At least, that's what I want right now.

speaker: Severa
text: You think I don't know that...? I mean, I DO know that, but...

speaker: Cordelia
text: I'm sorry I wasn't a better mother to you.

speaker: Severa
text: Well, you're still MY mother, which makes you the best mother in the world.

speaker: Cordelia
text: And the luckiest, it seems.

speaker: Severa
text: Oh, Mom, I missed you so much! I... I'm sorry I was so mean... I just... I didn't want to lose you again... Promise you won't leave, okay? Promise!

speaker: Cordelia
text: I promise.

speaker: Frederick
text: Milord, look! Risen!

speaker: Chrom
text: Ugh, and there's a village just ahead. Come on!

speaker: Villager
text: Help! Heeelp! Open the gates! The dead walk the earth! If you've any kindness in you, open the gates! We're from Woodham, up the road! You KNOW us! Please, open the— Gods, no. ...No! They're here! Aaaiiieeeeee!

speaker: Frederick
text: Hmm... The townsfolk of this village are renowned for their hospitality. How could they turn away refugees fearing for their lives?

speaker: Chrom
text: Let's worry about saving those lives first. We can ask questions later.

speaker: Elder
text: Shepherds are always welcome here. Please, take this with you.

speaker: Elder
text: Shepherds are always welcome here. Please, take this with you.

speaker: Chrom
text: Listen. There were refugees here and you turned them away. Why?

speaker: Elder
text: We're a peaceful town, sir. We have no weapons, nor any want for them. We survive by barring our gates to those who might bring us harm—friend or foe. Harsh as it may be, I can't have my people dying on account of other folks' problems...

speaker: Chrom
text: Are you all right?!

speaker: Villager
text: Oh, thank goodness you've come! Are you here to help us?

speaker: Chrom
text: We'll hold them off! Run!

speaker: Villager
text: U-understood! If we make it out alive, I'll repay you! I swear!

speaker: Villager
text: I've not the words to thank you, nor the treasure to pay you, but...here. Take this. I didn't think people like you still existed. I'll...I'll never forget this.

speaker: Frederick
text: Do you suppose the village will continue to bar its gates to refugees?

speaker: Chrom
text: As long as they view the Risen as someone else's problem, then yes.

speaker: Frederick
text: They claim to love peace... Yet the uneasy peace found behind a barricade is nothing I'd want. Peace begins when the fighting is over and the barricades come down. I pray they can see the truth of that before it's too late...

speaker: Chrom
text: ...A mirage village?

speaker: Elder
text: Or rumors of one, at any rate. People claim to have spied a desert village that sometimes appears during sandstorms. Tales speak of a legendary Goddess Staff that sleeps there, but who can really say?

speaker: Chrom
text: That sounds like it could be helpful. It may be nothing more than idle talk, but it still bears further investigation.

speaker: Elder
text: Just take care, sir. The sands are home to armed barbarians. Every year sees a few villagers go chasing the myth and finding the grave instead. I'll not stop you, but be sure you're well armed and fully prepared.

speaker: Nombry
text: Here we are, boys! The golden oasis! They say the villages around here are filled to burstin' with rare treasure! Kick down every door ya see! Don't let a single coin slip by!

speaker: Laurent
text: Eureka! It's you!

speaker: Miriel
text: ...Curious. I have no recollection of making your acquaintance. Though few things are as unreliable as the human memory.

speaker: Laurent
text: Ah, forgive me. I forgot that you have not met me before. My name is Laurent. Are you here in search of the mirage village?

speaker: Miriel
text: That is my cause, yes.

speaker: Laurent
text: Mine as well, though I fear my efforts thus far yield precious little progress. Still, an excess of evidence exists for the village to be baseless rumor alone...

speaker: Miriel
text: An assumption on your part, that.

speaker: Laurent
text: Might I accompany you in your search? I feel certain that your help will lay exposed that which has eluded me alone.

speaker: Miriel
text: Mmm. I worry your hypothesis lacks a certain scientific rigor... And yet, there exists the possibility I am in error on this count... So...yes. You are welcome to join us.

speaker: Laurent
text: Excelsior! I assure you, I'll not be a burden.

speaker: Laurent
text: Chrom? Is that you?

speaker: Chrom
text: Er, yes. And you are...?

speaker: Laurent
text: Ah, apologies! I am Laurent, a traveling mage and scholar. And perhaps more saliently, I am Miriel's son.

speaker: Chrom
text: Wait, you mean OUR Miriel? Oh, right. So then you must have traveled back and... Er, right?

speaker: Laurent
text: Excellent! Your comprehension spares me the botheration of further explication.

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Yep. You're Miriel's kid all right. So have you come all this way in search of your mother?

speaker: Laurent
text: Just so. She wrote of a mirage village in one of her records. I thought it might offer some clue to her current whereabouts. And acquiring the Goddess Staff is a worthy motive, besides.

speaker: Chrom
text: Any luck with that?

speaker: Laurent
text: Nay, sir. Much to my vexation, staff and village both elude me.

speaker: Chrom
text: I suppose it wouldn't be a legend if you could just stumble upon it in the market.

speaker: Laurent
text: Well put! And yet, not all is lost. Meeting you here is success enough. I was quickly reaching the limits of what one man can do alone. Might I lend my might to your cause? I assure you I will not be a burden.

speaker: Chrom
text: Of course. We'd love to have you.

speaker: Laurent
text: Excelsior!

speaker: Laurent
text: That mirage village must be located very near to here... Though I fear my own search for it has borne naught but ill fruit. No doubt Mother would have this mystery unraveled in moments, were she here...

speaker: Elder
text: Not many make it out this far. You must be near exhausted from the sands. Here, then. Take this as a reward for your efforts.

speaker: Elder
text: ...A mirage village? No, I'm afraid we're quite the ordinary one! Ha ha ha! Perhaps you'll find what you seek further west...

speaker: Elder
text: Not many make it out this far. You must be near exhausted from the sands. Here, then. Take this as a reward for your efforts. ...A mirage village? No, everyone can see us just fine! Ha ha ha! Perhaps you'll find what you seek on the far side of the oasis...

speaker: Elder
text: Not many make it out this far. You must be near exhausted from the sands. Here, then. Take this as a reward for your efforts. ...A mirage village? Yes, my mum used to sing cradle songs of such a thing. Find the last tree north of the oasis shore... Then two steps north and one step more! Er, or something like that. It's not like the place really exists, anyway.

speaker: Elder
text: Well, well. This village does not often play host to outsiders... Few hold faith in that which cannot be seen to exist, yet I sense such faith in you. Here, then. Claim what you have come for. I hold my own faith that you will use it with wisdom.

speaker: Nombry
text: Where's that magic mirage village at? Talk, or I'll make you vanish, too!

speaker: Chrom
text: The battle is won, and the sun is fading. We'd best make tracks.

speaker: Chrom
text: Just what was that place, in the end? Something beyond our ken, I suppose... Maybe a small proof that faith, even in the intangible, can still be rewarded? Like faith in a better future, perhaps. ...Heh. That's treasure enough for me.

speaker: Laurent
text: Might I have a word?

speaker: Miriel
text: I don't see why not.

speaker: Laurent
text: Tell me honestly—how would you assess my performance?

speaker: Miriel
text: You have certain natural deficiencies, but you compensate for them well. I surmise this is the product of considerable time and effort.

speaker: Laurent
text: Hah! The best response yet! You're as perspicacious as you are blunt, Mother.

speaker: Miriel
text: Mother?

speaker: Laurent
text: Indeed. I am your future progeny.

speaker: Miriel
text: Do you have concrete evidence to substantiate this proposition?

speaker: Laurent
text: I have a ring which is the same as yours. Quite literally.

speaker: Miriel
text: ...Fascinating. It does appear identical.

speaker: Laurent
text: Do two instances of a unique object coexisting constitute sufficient proof?

speaker: Miriel
text: To be sure, time travel is one viable hypothesis to explain the rings. But the possibility also exists that you pilfered the ring from said time traveler. As a means of identification, I fear it inconclusive.

speaker: Laurent
text: ...An astute criticism. I'm uncertain that any truly conclusive case can be mounted to prove my claim. But I intend to spend the rest of my life investigating the matter, if necessary. A single-minded pursuit of the truth may be the best proof of my heredity.

speaker: Miriel
text: This is a reasonable assumption. But I'm afraid a unilateral investigation is hardly credible.

speaker: Laurent
text: Then how should--

speaker: Miriel
text: However, I have no material evidence to suggest you are not, as you claim, my son. I shall conduct an inquiry of my own. We'll investigate the matter until a clear conclusion emerges. ...Together. Until then, I will grant the fundamental assumption that you are, in fact, my child.

speaker: Laurent
text: ...Thank you, Mother.

speaker: Xalbador
text: There's nothin' like war for the self-made man! No, sir! The strong rise to the top while the high-borns try to keep the blue blood inside 'em.

speaker: Elder
text: Hold, defiler! This is sacred ground! Your wickedness will be punished!

speaker: Xalbador
text: By who? The same gods that abandoned me when I was starving as a boy? When you see the gods, tell 'em I said they can rot in hell!

speaker: Elder
text: Hnngh! Gah...

speaker: Brady
text: Dastard! I'll gut ya for that!

speaker: Villager
text: Brady, no! There's nothing you can do! Who would tend to the injured if we lost you?

speaker: Brady
text: But...

speaker: Villager
text: We'll fight as best we're able! You help from the rear lines.

speaker: Brady
text: Ugh! Good people are dying, and I can't help! If only I could fight...

speaker: Maribelle
text: Chrom! We have to hurry!

speaker: Chrom
text: What's wrong, Maribelle?

speaker: Maribelle
text: There're people fighting just over that ridge! LOTS of people!

speaker: Chrom
text: They look like they need help. Let's go, Shepherds!

speaker: Villager
text: H-help us! Please! The temple's beset by marauding bandits!

speaker: Maribelle
text: Don't you worry! We're happy to help! If there's one thing this world needs less of, it's wretched bandits…

speaker: Brady
text: Wait. I know that voice. Is that...Ma?

speaker: Brady
text: Haw haw haw! Oh, that's her. That's gotta be her.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Pardon me, you mannerless cur! I will not stand to be laughed at by a base scoundrel of your like!

speaker: Brady
text: ...Yep. That clinches it. You must be Maribelle.

speaker: Maribelle
text: And just how do you know that?! Do you leer at me from behind the shades of whatever den of iniquity you frequent?! Hmph! I bid you good day!

speaker: Brady
text: I guess you've always been like this. Still...it's good to see you again. And now that I've found ya, I'm afraid you're stuck with me.

speaker: Brady
text: An enemy?! Damn! Guess that's it for me... Sorry, Ma. Looks like I won't be home for supper after all. Do your worst, tyrant! I can't fight back anyway!

speaker: Chrom
text: You seem to be doing just fine to me.

speaker: Brady
text: I'm unarmed, genius! Sheesh, anyone with eyes can see that!

speaker: Chrom
text: And anyone with eyes knows there's more to combat than swinging a blade around. You fight in your own way. Am I wrong?

speaker: Brady
