text: Pah! Don't patronize me! I'd love to fight more'n anything, but I can't seem to make it work.

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm sure something will come to you.

speaker: Brady
text: ...Just who are you, anyway?

speaker: Chrom
text: My name is Chrom.

speaker: Brady
text: What? Y-you're Chrom?!

speaker: Chrom
text: You know me?

speaker: Brady
text: Ma wouldn't shut up about you!

speaker: Chrom
text: Er, do I know your mother?

speaker: Brady
text: Her name's Maribelle.

speaker: Chrom
text: What?! So you're another traveler from the futu-

speaker: Brady
text: So you've already heard? Perfect. Now take me with ya already!

speaker: Chrom
text: Er, well, I suppose we can find a place for you somewhere...

speaker: Brady
text: Ha! I hear you there, chump! You can come kill me now. You're just lucky I don't have my old man's skill with a blade.

speaker: Chrom
text: Your father is a swordsman?

speaker: Brady
text: None of your damn business, dog!

speaker: Chrom
text: Do you always speak this way to Ylissean royalty?

speaker: Brady
text: I am Ylissean royalty!

speaker: Chrom
text: ... What?

speaker: Brady
text: ... Huh?

speaker: Chrom
text: Humor me here for a moment. What's your mother's name?

speaker: Brady
text: Maribelle.

speaker: Chrom
text: Maribelle is my wife... Which would make you my son. Seems Lucina failed to mention this little detail.

speaker: Brady
text: Huh. Yeah, I guess we look alike. I mean, if ya squint real hard... Sorry I called you a dog, Pop... Oh, and I'm Brady. Sooo... Must be disappointin' that your son can't fight, huh?

speaker: Chrom
text: You seem to be doing just fine to me. And anyone with eyes knows there's more to combat than swinging a blade around. And besides, you've chosen to heal instead of harm. I couldn't be prouder of that.

speaker: Brady
text: ...Really? Aw, thanks. That means a lot, Pop.

speaker: Xalbador
text: You people can keep your gods. I'll put my faith in gold and steel!

speaker: Elder
text: Thank you! Oh, thank you... You've kept this sacred place safe and spared the lives of those within.

speaker: Chrom
text: We just did what was right.

speaker: Elder
text: Would that everyone were so brave! Please, allow me to give you this.

speaker: Brady
text: Hey, Ma.

speaker: Maribelle
text: What did you call me?

speaker: Brady
text: The name's Brady. I'm--

speaker: Maribelle
text: I'm sorry, but I only heal physical ailments. Broken bones and the like. You're clearly a deeply troubled individual whose diseased mind is beyond my healing.

speaker: Brady
text: Stop talking for a minute and look at this!

speaker: Maribelle
text: That's... my ring! Then, that makes you...

speaker: Brady
text: Right. Like I was trying to say, I'm--

speaker: Maribelle
text: A thief! A rapscallion! A common lowborne cutpurse! How dare you sneak in here and steal my prized possessions!

speaker: Brady
text: Gawds! Stop interruptin' me for one blessed second, and check yer ring!

speaker: Maribelle
text: ...Oh. It's still here.

speaker: Brady
text: That clear things up any, Ma?"

speaker: Maribelle
text: Everything save how I gave birth to a common thug!

speaker: Brady
text: Aw, come on, Ma! That's harsh! Sure, I'm not the prettiest guy around, but I'm no thug, and I AM your son! ...And it's good to see you.

speaker: Maribelle
text: ...How did I ever permit my child to grow up referring to me as "Ma"?

speaker: Brady
text: You gave up tryin' after a decade or so.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Well, can you at least ride? Have you read the classics? Do you play violin? Chess?!

speaker: Brady
text: Yeah, all of the above. You beat all'a that junk into me.

speaker: Maribelle
text: Glory be! My son is salvageable after all!

speaker: Brady
text: Uh... thanks?

speaker: Maribelle
text: Don't look so forlorn, dear. You've come a long way, but Mother's here now. I'll take care of things from now on.

speaker: Brady
text: *Sniff* I missed you so much, Ma...

speaker: Maribelle
text: Do not even THINK of crying! It does not befit one of your station! *Sniff* Plus, you'll set me off as well...

speaker: Brady
text: S-sorry, I just... I... Oh, Ma!

speaker: Maribelle
text: Oh, Brady!

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh, brother.

speaker: Lissa
text: Say, Lucina? I'm still around in your future, right?

speaker: Lucina
text: Well... You're warm and kind, for starters. Even amid the darkness and desolation. Your smile serves as a beacon of hope for all those around you.

speaker: Lissa
text: Oh geez! I'd better get cracking if I want to live up to that. Oh! I know! Do I have any children?

speaker: Lucina
text: You have a son named Owain.

speaker: Lissa
text: Aw cute! What's he like?

speaker: Lucina
text: He's... Well, he's quite colorful.

speaker: Lissa
text: Hmm... I'm not sure I want to know what that means. Oh wait! One more thing! Does he have...

speaker: Lucina
text: Yes?

speaker: Lissa
text: No... Never mind.

speaker: Lucina
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Lissa
text: Sorry, I just remembered I promised to help Chrom with something. ...Bye!

speaker: Lucina
text: Lissa?

speaker: Ruffian
text: This is it boss! That treasure's here; I'm sure of it!

speaker: Gecko
text: All right, woman. Speak! Where'd you put it?

speaker: Maiden
text: I've never heard of no treasure here! Honest I haven't!

speaker: Gecko
text: Oh? Then I guess we're done here. She's useless, boys. Kill her.

speaker: Ruffian
text: Aye, boss!
Halt, fiends!

speaker: Ruffian
text: The devil are you?!
One chosen by forces beyond mortal comprehension! See how my sword hand twitches! It hungers... for justice! Leave now if you value life and limb, for I cannot stay the hungry hand!

speaker: Ruffian
text: This guy's got rocks in his head... All right then boy. Guess you're the first to—— Gragh!
I tried to warn you, foul villain. The hand cannot be denied!

speaker: Maiden
text: Oh thank the stars! You saved my life!

speaker: Chrom
text: Wait. That stance...

speaker: Gecko
text: Rgh... Who ARE you?!
I am the wolf who howls for justice! The eagle who cries for love!

speaker: Owain
text: A chosen warrior come from the future to bring hope for a dying world... I am Owain! Now, atone for your deeds in the eternal hellfire of perdition! RADIANT...DAAAAAAWN! ..... Blast you, sword hand! Now's no time for games! You've escaped fate this time, rogue, but remember——justice always prevails!

speaker: Lissa
text: Wow, that guy's really weird. ...Wait a second.

speaker: Gecko
text: Gahar har har! I KNEW there were rocks in your head! Look lively, boys! Ignore the dolt and find us that treasure! Pinch everything that shines, and make for the hills!

speaker: Owain
text: Not today, ne'er-do-wells! The legendary blade Mystletainn is fated for my twitching hand alone!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...I am so lost right now. What is he even talking about? ...Never mind. Let's just kill the bandits, and I'm sure everything will sort itself out.

speaker: Owain
text: Nrgh! Sword hand, no! Control yourself! P-power... too great... C-can't contain it...

speaker: Chrom
text: Um, sorry to interrupt your... conversation? But I have a question about your stance. You've crafted your own style around it, but it's clearly from the royal house of Ylisse.

speaker: Owain
text: By the gods old and new! Another future traveler?! And yet, impossible, for I saw none like him in the light... Who are you, villain?! Speak now!

speaker: Chrom
text: Um, I'm Chrom. ...Of Ylisse? I have no quarrel with you, but if we must fight, then-

speaker: Owain
text: UNCLE CHROM?!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...Uncle?

speaker: Owain
text: Wait! Hold on! Let me start over. O fellow scion of the great hero, I greet you as kin and kind! From across the misty shores of time I strive, bearing forth tidings of-

speaker: Chrom
text: Keep it brief, would you?

speaker: Owain
text: ...I'm Lissa's kid from the future!

speaker: Chrom
text: That is... not what I was expecting to hear. Did you come with Lucina?

speaker: Owain
text: Yes. It seems the blood we share has drawn us like moths to the flame! Like a great tidal wave of heroism, we crash upon the shores of evil and-

speaker: Chrom
text: Can you fight? Or do you just talk a lot?

speaker: Owain
text: My mettle in combat is the stuff of legend! Bards sing tales of my- H-hey! Wait! Uncle Chrooom! I have but one request. If you find the sword Mystletainn, please permit me to wield it!

speaker: Chrom
text: I heard you wailing about that before. What kind of blade are we talking here?

speaker: Owain
text: A legendary one, Uncle! Imbued with the very power of the gods, if the tales are to be believed. I would use its might to defend my sacred queen and mother!

speaker: Chrom
text: ...You mean Lissa? *Sigh* I suppose I should just be happy she has such a... devoted son.

speaker: Lissa
text: Oh, hey! It's you. Thanks for helping-

speaker: Owain
text: MOM?!

speaker: Lissa
text: Hu-what?

speaker: Owain
text: Blessed Mother! I have crossed oceans of time to find- Oh, forget it. I'm your kid from the future! Look at the signet ring upon my finger. Behold, a perfect match to yours! Unique in all the world, and yet here lie two. Proof positive my claims are true!

speaker: Lissa
text: ... Who did what now? Hold on. Slow down. Back up. Start again.

speaker: Owain
text: Um... Sorry about that. Look, the important thing here is that I'm-

speaker: Lissa
text: ...Oh, gods. Owain.

speaker: Owain
text: Huh?

speaker: Lissa
text: That's your name. Isn't it?

speaker: Owain
text: Indeed it is! And none have ever been prouder to bear it! For it is the name you gave me, Mother! I've come to part the dark clouds that hang forebodingly over this era!

speaker: Villager
text: Hail, traveler. Thank you for coming to our aid. Please use this to treat your injured. It's an old recipe, but well effective.

speaker: Villager
text: You're a welcome sight indeed. I'd near given up hope! This is one of our village treasures. May it help you in keeping us safe.

speaker: Villager
text: You have our thanks for your bravery. I'm afraid this medicine is all I can offer in return, but I pray it keeps you safe.

speaker: Villager
text: You're a kind soul to fight for strangers so. Here, you must take this.

speaker: Owain
text: By the ghost of Ike! I've found it at last! The fated mate of my sword hand! ...The divine blade, Mystletainn!

speaker: Villager
text: Er, I'm afraid this is a blade of extremely common make, sir. I was using it to dig a well, but I figured you might--

speaker: Owain
text: Come, Mystletainn! Destiny beckons!

speaker: Villager
text: I also used it to cut small vegetables before it got dull. ...Er, hello?

speaker: Owain
text: The blade of legend and song... I feel its power coursing through me! At last, my sword hand lays calm. Come, Mystletainn. Destiny beckons! The rest of these rogues are ours alone!

speaker: Gecko
text: This treasure's mine! Cross me, and I'll decorate this place with your bones!

speaker: Villager
text: We owe you a great debt for protecting our village. Truly, from all of us, thank you.

speaker: Lissa
text: Where did he get off to? Lucina said she saw him go this way. ..... Ugh, maybe I should just forget it. If he doesn't have one, either.....  Aaah!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Keh heh! Let's have all your coin girly! Unless you wanna lose that pretty head.

speaker: Lissa
text: Stay back!

speaker: Owain
text: No one hurts the mother of Owain! SACRED...STOOOOOONES!

speaker: Ruffian
text: Guhaaargh!

speaker: Owain
text: Mother, are you all right?!

speaker: Lissa
text: Yeah, I'm fine. I'm... Holy crow! Your arm!

speaker: Owain
text: This? Hah! It's nothing but a torn sleeve.

speaker: Lissa
text: ...No, I mean, HOLY CROW! LOOK AT THAT THING ON YOUR ARM!

speaker: Owain
text: Oh right! Sorry. Guess I should have shown you before. It's my Brand. The one carried by House Ylisse. So no more need to worry, eh?

speaker: Lissa
text: Th-then you know? That I don't...

speaker: Owain
text: That your Brand never surfaced? Yes, you told me as much. You said it always weighed on you... You should have seen how happy you were the day mine appeared! You were sobbing and laughing for an hour without pause!

speaker: Lissa
text: I was kind of hoping to grow out of the crying thing...

speaker: Owain
text: Yes, well. No more worrying. It was by chance alone that your Brand never surfaced. We're all family, linked by blood. You really are Chrom's sister. My Brand proves our lineage.

speaker: Lissa
text: Thank you. Just... *sniff* Thank you, Owain.

speaker: Owain
text: You're welcome!

speaker: Lissa
text: Heh... *sniff*

speaker: Owain
text: And as scions of the hero, it falls on us to ensure my dark future doesn't come true. Come, Mother! We shall fight together! Uh-oh... Argh... Too much...passion! Sword hand...getting hungry...again!

speaker: Lissa
text: You know, maybe you should have that looked at.

speaker: Robin
text: *Huff, huff* Why do mountains... have to... be so steep?

speaker: Olivia
text: Here. Have some water.

speaker: Robin
text: Thank you, Olivia. You're a lifesaver.

speaker: Olivia
text: Oh, hardly. I just flail around and pretend to dance, mostly. Anyway, I've started looking for new ways to be useful.

speaker: Robin
text: Your dancing is spectacular! It never fails to pick me up.

speaker: Olivia
text: Ha! I dance like a ham someone rolled down the stairs. Just thinking of people watching me makes me cringe...

speaker: Chrom
text: We're near the bandit's camp, Robin. They've ravaged surrounding towns with impunity for too long. It ends today.

speaker: Robin
text: Right.

speaker: Inigo
text: Not today, rogue!

speaker: Brigand
text: Nraugh!

speaker: Inigo
text: All safe now, buttercup.

speaker: Maiden
text: I-Inigo?!

speaker: Inigo
text: The crying part is over, love. Now give us a smile. And perhaps a wink if a fellow can be greedy?

speaker: Maiden
text: Inigo, you stupid fool! That bandit you slew has---

speaker: Inigo
text: Dozens of friends who will be terribly cross with me? Aye. Worry not! I'll mop up the lot of them and be back in time for tea.

speaker: Maiden
text: You mustn't! They'll kill you!

speaker: Inigo
text: Ho ho! Don't be silly. I'd never let anyone ruin this perfect face. Surely you want them gone as well, yes? So that you may rebuild in peace?

speaker: Maiden
text: Of course, but...

speaker: Inigo
text: Then let us have no more frowns! A smile like yours is not a treasure to be locked in the king's dungeons! I'll meet you in town once I've sorted those pesky bandits. Perhaps then we can discuss my... reward. Ho ho!

speaker: Chrom
text: Their hold is just ahead. It should be... Wait, what's that? Gods, that man is fighting them alone. Come, let's lend him a hand!

speaker: Olivia
text: Are... Are you all right?

speaker: Inigo
text: ...GYAAARRGH!

speaker: Olivia
text: EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK! Wh-what's wrong?!

speaker: Inigo
text: S-sorry! ...Sorry. You just surprised me.

speaker: Olivia
text: I'd say we're even on that count!

speaker: Inigo
text: I shouldn't have shouted, but... Er, yes. Can we please start over? ...Ahem! It was your ravishing beauty that caught me so off guard, milady!

speaker: Olivia
text: I don't quite know how to reply to that!

speaker: Inigo
text: Er, please don't look at me so...intently. It makes me terribly bashful.

speaker: Olivia
text: What?! W-wait! Don't go! Drat he's gone. He totally stole my line, too. Still it's weird, I didn't have a problem talking to him. Maybe his shyness countered my own?

speaker: Inigo
text: Well, then. I should think five kills would be enough to impress a simple village girl. Though six might earn me a sweet kiss... Hmmm... That IS tempting.

speaker: Chrom
text: You all right?

speaker: Inigo
text: Me? Hah! It takes more than that to wound a rogue this charming! Now then, who are you? Not an enemy, it seems?

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm Chrom, leader of the Shepherds. We came to deal with bandits, so it appears our purpose is shared.

speaker: Inigo
text: Chrom?! Then you're Lucina's...

speaker: Chrom
text: What's that?

speaker: Chrom
text: What?

speaker: Inigo
text: P-please don't stare at me like that. I get so...terribly shy.

speaker: Chrom
text: Aren't you the one who's been staring at me? And why did that line seem so familiar?

speaker: Inigo
text: Er, but yes! We share a common foe, and I'm grateful for the help. Can I trust you to defend this place?

speaker: Chrom
text: I don't know. What are you planning?

speaker: Inigo
text: I aim to crush the rascals who make trouble for the village, naturally! And once the lot of them are sorted, it's off to tea with a beauty of the fields. Heh heh heh... Right then! If that's decided, I'll be on my way. Put the kettle on, snookums! I won't be long now!

speaker: Chrom
text: He's nothing if not eager...

speaker: Inigo
text: Well, then. I should think five kills would be enough to impress a simple village girl. Though six might earn me a sweet kiss... Hmmm... That IS tempting.

speaker: Chrom
text: You all right?

speaker: Inigo
text: Me? Hah! It takes more then that to wound a rogue this charming! Now then, who are you? Not an enemy, it seems.

speaker: Chrom
text: I'm Chrom, leader of the Shepherds. We came to deal with the bandits, so it appears our purpose is shared.

speaker: Inigo
text: Chrom?! Then you...You're my father.

speaker: Chrom
text: What? You, too?!

speaker: Inigo
text: Then you've already met Lucina?!

speaker: Chrom
text: Yes, she's with us now.

speaker: Inigo
text: Oh, good. She was so terribly eager to see you! Ah, but forgive me. I still haven't introduced myself. I am Inigo, Lucina's younger brother and a crown prince of Ylisse myself. If you need further proof, I bear a Brand in the opposite eye as Lucina.

speaker: Chrom
text: Hmm...Yep. That's a Brand all right.

speaker: Inigo
text: Um, could I ask you to stop staring now? I get a bit...bashful.

speaker: Chrom
text: Ah, right. Sorry

speaker: Inigo
text: Aha ha! Not to worry. Now, then. It's back into the fray with me, Father. Then it's off for tea with a farm girl! ...And perhaps a bit more. Don't wait up! Aha ha ha!

speaker: Chrom
text: Oh gods. I raised a philanderer. ...Well, he seems content enough. Heh. A son. Who knew?

speaker: Inigo
text: Well, then. I should think five kills would be enough to impress a simple village girl. Though six might earn me a sweet kiss... Hmm... That IS tempting...

speaker: Jamil
text: All who defy the will of Grima will be purged in the flames of destruction!

speaker: Jamil
text: Lord Grima... Rain down...retribution...

speaker: Chrom
text: That's the last of the bandits. The hold is reclaimed.

speaker: Frederick
text: The villagers will sleep better for our good works, milord.

speaker: Maiden
text: I can't begin to thank you, good sir

speaker: Chrom
text: Actually, Inigo did most of the heavy lifting on this one.

speaker: Maiden
text: He is so terribly brave... Part of me wishes I could have been there to witness it. Er, but yes. Please accept this gift from all us villagers.

speaker: Chrom
text: Your kindness flatters me. If bandits ever trouble you again, you need but call and we'll come running. Rebuilding a town is hard work, but I trust you'll be just fine.

speaker: Maiden
text: We'll do our best!

speaker: Inigo
text: Um... Olivia? Might I have a moment?

speaker: Olivia
text: Wh-what? With me? Why?! ...Wait, how did you know my name?

speaker: Inigo
text: A little bird tweeted it out. So is that a yes?

speaker: Olivia
text: Um, all right, I guess.

speaker: Inigo
text: ...Er, yes. You see... What I mean to say is... Goodness, this is much harder than chatting up other girls I've met. I suppose it would be quickest to just show you this...

speaker: Olivia
text: M-my ring? But... I'm wearing it! How did you...?

speaker: Inigo
text: Indeed. How does Inigo have your ring when there is only one in all the world? Unless it IS your ring and I brought it back from the future!

speaker: Olivia
text: What? You mean like Lucina...?

speaker: Inigo
text: Exactly. I knew my mother was a dancer you see. So I've been scouring the land looking for all the dancers I could find. Not the worst job in the world, mind. Heh heh heh... But now I've finally found you Mother! And my dancing is all the better for it!

speaker: Olivia
text: Oh! You dance?

speaker: Inigo
text: Er sort of, yes. That is to say, I try my best. But some people don't appreciate male dancers. Not that I care! I'm content to just shake my hips for the ladies.

speaker: Olivia
text: Oh, don't listen to them! I think it's wonderful. I'd... love to watch you dance sometime.

speaker: Inigo
text: N-no! Impossible! I'd be far too embarrassed for that! Besides, I'd rather watch you dance.

speaker: Olivia
text: What?! N-no! I couldn't possibly!

speaker: Inigo
text: I'm shyer than you are, Mother!

speaker: Olivia
text: You are not!

speaker: Chrom
text: Would you two stop it already? Now I'm the one who's getting embarrassed...

speaker: Inigo
text: At last, teatime has arrived!

speaker: Chrom
text: We're leaving, Inigo.

speaker: Inigo
text: What, right now? B-but... teatime!

speaker: Chrom
text: War is hell, Inigo. Now come with us or be left behind.

speaker: Inigo
text: Fine, fine! I'm coming. ...I suppose there'll be more buttercups blooming along the road ahead.
